meanings.definition: To pay or provide for (expenses, costs, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She is defraying the cost of her college tuition with a part-time job.
meanings.sent2: The company is defraying the travel expenses for its employees.
meanings.sent3: Defraying the bill for dinner made him feel like a generous friend.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work was defraying the financial burden on her family.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship helped in defraying the educational expenses.

meanings.definition: To bear or pay all or part of (the costs, expenses, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The organization is defraying the costs of the charity event.
meanings.sent2: He defrayed the repair expenses for his car without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: Defraying the travel costs felt like a weight off his shoulders.
meanings.sent4: Her savings were defraying the financial strain of the unexpected medical bills.
meanings.sent5: The fundraiser was successful in defraying the project expenses.
